         <div class="Title">
          <h2>
           Fruit Cobbler Jam Recipe
          </h2>
         </div>
         <p class="Date">
          8/15/2014 9:18:00 AM
         </p>
         <p class="Byline">
          By
          <a href="http://www.motherearthnews.com/biographies/lanette-lepper-virginia-chicken-and-beekeeper.aspx" target="_self">
           Lanette Lepper
          </a>
         </p>
         <p class="Tags" id="browserv2_0_blogitemleftcolumn_0_pTags">
          Tags:
          <a href='/search.aspx?tags="low sugar jam"'>
           low sugar jam
          </a>
          ,
          <a href='/search.aspx?tags="Virginia"'>
           Virginia
          </a>
          ,
          <a href='/search.aspx?tags="Lanette Lepper"'>
           Lanette Lepper
          </a>
         </p>
         <div class="Body">
          <p>
           A few years ago, I made Peach Cobbler Jam using
           <a href="http://chickensintheroad.com/farm-bell-recipes/peach-cobbler-jam/" target="_blank">
            this recipe
           </a>
           . It was absolutely delicious, and since then I have made it numerous times, modifying it slightly because I prefer to make low-sugar jams using Pomona's Pectin. This summer, I decided to branch out and try it using different fruit. The Cherry Cobbler jam was amazing, and today's Blackberry Nectarine Cobbler Jam was so good I decided this was definitely a recipe worth sharing!
          </p>
          <p>
           Normally, I don't recommend changing canning recipes. When it comes to acidity levels and all that jazz, I always err on the side of caution. However, thanks to the handy-dandy guide that comes in every package of Pomona's Pectin, I know that the 1/4 cup of lemon juice is enough to do the trick!
          </p>
          <p>
           <img alt="Cobbler Jam" src="~/media/Images/MEN/Editorial/Blogs/Real%20Food/Fruit%20Cobbler%20Jam/IMG_6697.JPG" style="padding: 10px; width: 300px; height: 234px; float: left; margin: 10px;"/>
          </p>
          <h3>
           <strong>
            Fruit Cobbler Jam
           </strong>
          </h3>
          <p>
           <em>
            4 cups of pitted, peeled, chopped, mashed fruit (peach, nectarine, cherry, blackberry, blueberry, or a mixture)
            <br/>
            1/4 cup lemon juice
            <br/>
            4 tsp calcium water
            <br/>
            1 tsp cinnamon
            <br/>
            1/2 tsp nutmeg
            <br/>
            2 cups sugar
            <br/>
            1 tbsp Pomona's Pectin
            <br/>
            1-1/2 tsp vanilla extract (or almond, which is great with cherries!)
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           Combine fruit, lemon juice, calcium water, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a large pot. Measure sugar and Pomona's Pectin in a separate bowl, stirring well to combine. Bring fruit to a boil, and add sugar slowly. Mix well for 1-2 minutes to dissolve pectin. Return to a boil and remove from heat. Fill jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace. Boil in a hot water bath for 10 minutes (add 1 minute more for every 1,000 ft above sea level). Let jars cool, and check seals.
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>

     function getWidth() {
            xWidth = null;
            if (window.screen != null)
                xWidth = window.screen.availWidth;

            if (window.innerWidth != null)
                xWidth = window.innerWidth;

            if (document.body != null)
                xWidth = document.body.clientWidth;

            return xWidth;

 var prev_handler = window.onload;

     }
        window.onload = function(event) {
        var left = parseInt(document.getElementById('LeftLayout').offsetWidth);
        var right = parseInt(document.getElementById('RightLayout').offsetWidth);
        var body = parseInt(document.getElementById('ContentLayout').offsetWidth);
            var content = parseInt(left) + parseInt(right) + parseInt(body);
            var size = parseInt(getWidth()) - 1400;

            if (parseInt(size) &lt; 0) {
                document.getElementById('LeftLayout').style.visibility = 'hidden';
                document.getElementById('RightLayout').style.visibility = 'hidden';
                document.getElementById('LeftLayout').style.display = 'none';
                document.getElementById('RightLayout').style.display = 'none';
            }
            else {
                document.getElementById('LeftLayout').style.visibility = 'visible';
                document.getElementById('RightLayout').style.visibility = 'visible';
                document.getElementById('LeftLayout').style.display = 'block';
                document.getElementById('RightLayout').style.display = 'block';
            }
        }

        window.onresize = function(event) {
